Muniment.origin: [Anglo-French, from Middle French, defense, from Latin munimentum , from munire to fortify]

1.1: a record (as a deed, statutory grant, or judgment) that passes title to real property and enables a person to defend the title or otherwise maintain a claim to real rights or privileges [ of title] often used in pl. [the
1.s: of which the chain of record title is formed "
